name: places/ChIJi1t9GxVawokRGbE6by_b5zM
adrFormatAddress: 711 12th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Prominent Hell's Kitchen river terminal providing piers for cruise ships heading out to the ocean.

originalText.text:
Manhattan Cruise Terminal was nothing short of delightful. Nestled by the Hudson River, this spot offers a serene escape from the bustling city streets. The best times to indulge in its beauty are during the morning and afternoon hours, when the sunlight dances on the river’s surface, creating a mesmerizing view.

One striking feature of this location is the constant, refreshing breeze from the river. While it can be quite windy, this adds to the charm, especially on warmer days when a cool gust is most welcome. The open space near the terminal is perfect for a variety of activities. I noticed people engaged in exercises, some practicing yoga, while others simply sat enjoying the tranquility of the surroundings.

The blend of peaceful river views and the occasional sighting of a majestic cruise ship creates a unique backdrop. Whether you’re a local looking for a daily retreat or a visitor seeking a scenic spot to unwind, this area near the Manhattan Cruise Terminal is a wonderful choice. Its combination of natural beauty and urban accessibility makes it a must-visit location in New York City.

originalText.text: Not fancy but functional. Really busy place. Very difficult to drive to so we stayed at a nearby hotel with parking and shuttle service. Returning to the US on a cruise and going through customs was very smooth and quick!  Best thing is the view of the Statue of Liberty coming and going.

originalText.text: Would not book again ,they alot of changes before I never used them .the disorganization,  the slow Elevator, the room are like cheap motel,  the pool are small compared to the people's they book. It's  over crowded.  If you to book this boat ,update to windows or you feel  like your in jail.  If you're an person with disabilities  and your traveling with an guest make so the don't Reserve room with an bunker.  The food selection is like summer camps. When booking an Cruise ship go with an other is was my 2nd time. Less in an week. And 2nd time wasn't  wasn't and better. But some you meet going,serving person with good attitude .

originalText.text: Worst cruise terminal ever. The place is soooo crowded! It took us 4 hours to get onto the ship! There we're only 5-6 people checking people into the ship. The Baltimore port was so much better, it only took us 1 hour to get on to the ship! Overall worst cruise terminal ever.

originalText.text: Staff are so welcoming & ready to assist you! Great customer service. Exciting experience. You get your money's worth! Hope you enjoy .
